citations.narrative:
The facility is exhibiting an animal which is not authorized on their license. The facility obtained a black-handed spider
monkey on July 12, 2024, and have been exhibiting the animal since approx. mid-August, per the facility representative.
Licenses authorize a specific number and specific type(s) of animals for the use of regulated activity (i.e., exhibiting).
Licensure with the USDA must specifically authorize the use of group 6 non-human primates, which includes spider
monkey species.
The licensee must either remove this animal from exhibition permanently or must obtain a new license which authorizes
the use of this category of animal before continuing to exhibit this animal.
Correct by: Jan. 6, 2025

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a current formal arrangement with an Attending Veterinarian (AV). While the facility does have
informal arrangements with other veterinarians who provide care for the animals, the Program of Veterinary Care is
signed by the former AV who is stated to no longer serve this facility outside of emergency care.
Correct by updating the Program of Veterinary Care and documenting a formal arrangement with an Attending
Veterinarian to ensure adequate veterinary care to the facility’s animals in accordance with the AWA.
Correct by Jan. 6, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.1(b)(2)(ii) 
   
Requirements and application 
The facility is exhibiting an animal which is not authorized on their license. The facility obtained a black-handed spider 
monkey on July 12, 2024, and have been exhibiting the animal since approx. mid-August, per the facility representative.  
 
Licenses authorize a specific number and specific type(s) of animals for the use of regulated activity (i.e., exhibiting). 
Licensure with the USDA must specifically authorize the use of group 6 non-human primates, which includes spider 
monkey species.  
 
The licensee must either remove this animal from exhibition permanently or must obtain a new license which authorizes 
the use of this category of animal before continuing to exhibit this animal.  
 
Correct by: Jan. 6, 2025 
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility does not have a current formal arrangement with an Attending Veterinarian (AV). While the facility does have 
informal arrangements with other veterinarians who provide care for the animals, the Program of Veterinary Care is 
signed by the former AV who is stated to no longer serve this facility outside of emergency care.  
 
Correct by updating the Program of Veterinary Care and documenting a formal arrangement with an Attending 
Veterinarian to ensure adequate veterinary care to the facility’s animals in accordance with the AWA.  
 
Correct by Jan. 6, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.

n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
